article.headline: Okafor leads Huskies with 22 points, 18 boards
article.linkText: No. 8 UConn stifles St. John's in Big East
article.story:
NEW YORK (Ticker) -- Emeka Okafor had 22 points and 18 rebounds and No. 8 Connecticut limited St. John's to just three baskets in the first half of a 71-53 Big East Conference mismatch Tuesday night.

Okafor backstopped a defensive effort that saw Connecticut (22-5, 10-3 Big East) limit St. John's to 9 percent shooting (3-of-32) in the first half, opening a 33-16 lead.

Coming off Saturday's home win in which they limited Notre Dame to 30 percent from the field, the Huskies won on the road for the first time since Jan. 31.  They improved to 2-1 at Madison Square Garden this season, splitting a pair of Preseason NIT games in November.

Darryll Hill scored 21 points for the Red Storm (6-18, 1-12), who dropped to 4-14 under interim coach Kevin Clark.
